member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.CacheSerializerHints
member.summary: Set of properties that the token cache serialization implementations might use to optimize the cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.CacheSerializerHints.CancellationToken
member.summary: CancellationToken enabling cooperative cancellation between threads, thread pool, or Task objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.CacheSerializerHints.SuggestedCacheExpiry
member.summary: Suggested cache expiry based on the in-coming token. Use to optimize cache eviction with the app token cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.Distributed.DistributedTokenCacheAdapterExtension

member.returns: A to chain.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.Distributed.MsalDistributedTokenCacheAdapter
member.summary: An implementation of the token cache for both Confidential and Public clients backed by a Distributed Cache. The Distributed Cache (L2), by default creates a Memory Cache (L1), for faster look up, resulting in a two level cache.
LoggingMessage class for MsalDistributedTokenCacheAdapter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.Distributed.MsalDistributedTokenCacheAdapter._distributedCache
member.summary: .NET Core Memory cache.

member.summary: MSAL distributed token cache options.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Service provider. Can be null, in which case the token cache will not be encrypted. See https://aka.ms/ms-id-web/token-cache-encryption.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.Distributed.MsalDistributedTokenCacheAdapterOptions
member.summary: Options for the MSAL token cache serialization adapter, which delegates the serialization to the IDistributedCache implementations available with .NET Core.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.Distributed.MsalDistributedTokenCacheAdapterOptions.L1CacheOptions
member.summary: Options of the In Memory (L1) cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.Distributed.MsalDistributedTokenCacheAdapterOptions.OnL2CacheFailure
member.summary: Callback offered to the app to be notified when the L2 cache fails. This way the app is given the possibility to act on the L2 cache, for instance, in the case of Redis, to reconnect. This is left to the application as it's the only one that knows about the real implementation of the L2 cache. The handler should return true if the cache should try again the operation, and false otherwise. When true is passed and the retry fails, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.Distributed.MsalDistributedTokenCacheAdapterOptions.L1ExpirationTimeRatio
member.summary: Value more than 0, less than 1, to set the In Memory (L1) cache expiration time values relative to the Distributed (L2) cache. Default is 1.

members.member:
Should the token cache be encrypted.
The default is false.

Disable the L1 (InMemory) cache. Useful in scenarios where multiple apps share the same L2 cache.
The default is false.

Enable writing to the L2 cache to be async (fire and forget). This improves performance as the MSAL.NET will not have to wait for the write to complete.
The default is false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.InMemory.MsalMemoryTokenCacheOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. By default, the sliding expiration is set for 14 days.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.InMemory.MsalMemoryTokenCacheOptions.AbsoluteExpirationRelativeToNow
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the duration after which the cache entry will expire unless it's used This is the duration the tokens are kept in memory cache. In production, a higher value, up-to 90 days is recommended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.MsalAbstractTokenCacheProvider.OnAfterAccessAsync(Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCacheNotificationArgs)
member.summary: Raised AFTER MSAL added the new token in its in-memory copy of the cache. This notification is called every time MSAL accesses the cache, not just when a write takes place: If MSAL's current operation resulted in a cache change, the property TokenCacheNotificationArgs.HasStateChanged will be set to true. If that is the case, we call the TokenCache.SerializeMsalV3() to get a binary blob representing the latest cache content â€“ and persist it.
member.param: Contains parameters used by the MSAL call accessing the cache.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.MsalAbstractTokenCacheProvider.OnBeforeWriteAsync(Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCacheNotificationArgs)
member.summary: If you want to ensure that no concurrent write takes place, use this notification to place a lock on the entry.
member.returns: A that represents a completed operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods to expose a simplified developer experience for adding token caches to MSAL.NET confidential client applications in ASP.NET, or .NET Core, or .NET FW.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheExtensions.AddTokenCaches(Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication,System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection})
member.summary: Use a token cache and choose the serialization part by adding it to the services collection and configuring its options.
member.returns: The confidential client application.
member.param: Action that you'll use to add a cache serialization to the service collection passed as an argument.
member.returns: The application for chaining.
member.remarks: Don't use this method in ASP.NET Core. Just add use the ConfigureServices method instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheExtensions.AddInMemoryTokenCache(Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication)
member.summary: Add an in-memory well partitioned token cache to MSAL.NET confidential client application. Don't use this method in ASP.NET Core: rather use: services.AddInMemoryTokenCache() in ConfigureServices.
member.returns: The application for chaining.
member.example:
The following code adds an in-memory token cache.
app.AddInMemoryTokenCache();
member.remarks: Don't use this method in ASP.NET Core. Just add use the ConfigureServices method instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheExtensions.AddInMemoryTokenCache(Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication,System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection})
member.summary: Add an in-memory well partitioned token cache to MSAL.NET confidential client application. Don't use this method in ASP.NET Core: rather use: services.AddInMemoryTokenCache() in ConfigureServices.
member.param: Action taking a and by which you initialize your memory cache.
member.returns: The application for chaining.
member.remarks: Don't use this method in ASP.NET Core. Just add use the ConfigureServices method instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheExtensions.AddDistributedTokenCache(Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication,System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection})
member.summary: Add a distributed token cache.
member.param: Action taking a and by which you initialize your distributed cache.
member.returns: The application for chaining.
member.remarks: Don't use this method in ASP.NET Core. Just add use the ConfigureServices method instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.LoggingEventId
member.summary: EventIds for Logging.
